title: President Obama Nominates David L. McNulty to Serve as a U.S. Marshal | whitehouse.gov
content:
The White House
Office of the Press Secretary


For Immediate Release
March 31, 2011

 



President Obama Nominates David L. McNulty to Serve as a U.S. Marshal





	WASHINGTON- Today, President Obama nominated David L. McNulty to serve as a U.S. Marshal in the state of New York.
	 
	“Throughout his career, David L. McNulty has been a dedicated law enforcement professional who has shown an unwavering commitment to public service,” said President Obama.  “I am honored to nominate him to serve the American people as a U.S. Marshal.”
	 
David L. McNulty:  Nominee for United States Marshal for the Northern District of New York
	David L. McNulty currently serves as a Major with the New York State Police in Albany, New York.  Major McNulty rose through the New York State Police ranks after joining as a Trooper in 1978.  He received both his bachelors and masters degrees from the University at Albany—State University of New York.
